meta.description: This file is a description of a model train track layout.
explanation-of-this-layout-definition: Each track piece has a 'start side' and an 'end side.
The position of the 'start side' of the piece with id 1 is defined, as well as that piece's heading in degrees.
This position and heading define where the first piece is on the layout.
Each piece's 'connects' values indicate which other pieces it connects to.
The 'connects' information is used to figure out the coordinates of the rest of the track pieces.

piece-1.start: Start coordinate for the piece with ID 1

pieces.id: Unique identifier for a track piece
pieces.type: string referring to the piece type defined in piece-definitions.json
pieces.direction: direction the track is curving to, as seen from the direction of travel. For curved pieces use 'left' or 'right'. For straight pieces use 'null'.

connects.start: The identifier of the piece that the 'start side' of this piece is connected to.
connects.end: The identifier of the piece that the 'end side' of this piece is connected to.

pieces.anchor: Only one track piece can have this field. Identifies the anchor piece.
